trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of diet on risk of heart disease in people with diabetes
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of improving diet quality on measures of vascular function in people with type 1 and type 2 diabetes

interventions.interventions: This is a longitudinal randomised controlled trial with a 12 month intervention phase. Participants in the intervention group will be advised to increase their consumption of fruit (1 extra serve/day), vegetables (2 extra serves/day) and dairy (1 extra serve/day. Participants will choose which fruit, vegetables and dairy products they would like to increase their intake of.
interventions.comparator: The control group will not receive any dietary advie and will continue to consume their usual diet

primaryOutcome.outcome: Carotid intima media progression assessed using B mode ultrasound

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Central augmentation index, augmented pressure and pulse wave velocity measured using Sphygmo-CorEXCEL
Ultrasound measures of vascular compliance and stiffness in the carotid artery
Blood pressure measured using a automated sphygmomanometer

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Cancer Unstable cardiovascular disease requiring active intervention such as CABG or stenting in the next 3-4months Heart failkure of any degree Significant renal impairment i.e. eGFR <30ml/min Liver disease of any degree

trial_design.concealment: The study will be publically advertised. Participants will be randomised by computer generated random numbers to either the intervention or control group. Allocation will not be concealed
trial_design.sequence: Random numbers will be generated using a computer program
